comment.author: 39967544@N00
comment._content: This is one of P&O's "M" Class, 10 liners were built for the Australian service between 1903 (Moldavia) and 1911 (Medina), but 6 were lost to enemy action during World War 1, and the other 4 were scrapped during the early 1930s and replaced by the 5 Straths.

comment.author: 47044499@N03
comment._content: Elegant lines of a past era.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/39967544@N00] Brilliant! I was about to work through the list of "M" class ships, but think she is the first in the list, RMS MOLDAVIA (1) which was flagship for the Anniversary Day Regatta on Tuesday 26 January 1904. Illustrations of the event, showing ladies in white frocks boarding the MOLDAVIA - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/5702818 Read All About It! - "moored off Neutral Bay","NE winds" etc - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14595774 Description of the ship which had arrived four days previously on her maiden voyage - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14594783 Wikipedia - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RMS_Moldavia

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Hmmm - having second thoughts about this - I might have the wrong ship and year.  Comparing this photo with the photos in the AT&CJ (first link above), the flag on the aft mast is different, gangway is in the wrong place, davits are facing the wrong way ... etc.  Oh dear! Back to the drawing board ...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [parked here for reference] A list of Anniversary Day Regatta Flagships - 1900 - HIMALAYA (P&O) 1901 - BRITTANIA (P&O) 1902 - CHINA (P&O) 1903 - ARCADIA (P&O) 1904 - MOLDAVIA (P&O) trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14595774 1905 - BRITTANIA (P&O) 1906 - OROYA (Orient) 1907 - MONGOLIA (P&O) trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14853893 1908 - MACEDONIA (P&O) trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14927745 1909 - MOREA (P&O) 1910 - MARATHON (Aberdeen White Star) trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/15149911 1911 - MANTUA (P&O) trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/15213165 1912 - OMRAH (Orient) trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/15305525 1913 - MOREA (P&O) trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/15393481 1914 - OMRAH (Orient) trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/15491802 1915 - WOLLONGBAR (North Coast SNC) trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/15571317 ... ... ...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: ... which doesn't really help except to show there are many possibilities of "M" class P&O Anniversary Regatta flagships!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/39967544@N00] Thanks folks - another case of 'which liner is this?'. We've recorded your suggestions & put them in a safe place :)
